Message.Issue: 'ConsoleAuthoringScope' is marked ComVisible(true) but has the following ComVisible(false) types in its object hierarchy: 'AuthoringScope'

In method 'ConsoleWindow.ConsoleWindow()', call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object 'new ServiceProvider((IServiceProvider)Package.GetGlobalService(Type.GetTypeFromHandle(...)))' before all references to it are out of scope.
Implement IDisposable on 'EngineWrapper' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'PythonEngine'.
Implement IDisposable on 'IronPythonEngineProvider' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ServiceProvider'.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 's' can be disposed more than once in method 'TextBufferStream.Flush()'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 85

Rule.Name: COM visible type base types should be COM visible
Rule.Description: COM visible types should have an object hierarchy that is uniformly COM visible.
Rule.Resolution: {0} is marked ComVisible(true) but has the following ComVisible(false) types in its object hierarchy: {1}

Rule.Name: Dispose objects before losing scope
Rule.Description: If a disposable object is not explicitly disposed before all references to it are out of scope, the object will be disposed at some indeterminate time when the garbage collector runs the finalizer of the object. Because an exceptional event might occur that will prevent the finalizer of the object from running, the object should be explicitly disposed instead.
Rule.Resolution: In method {0}, call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object {1} before all references to it are out of scope.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 85

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.
